basics.name: John Seibert
basics.label: Mathematics & Computer Science Researcher
basics.summary: Honors student graduating in Fall 2025 with a double major in Mathematics and Computer Science with a thesis on combinatorial design theory. Research experiences in machine learning and bioinformatics through NSF (at UC Riverside) and Geisinger Health System.

work.name: University of California, Riverside
work.summary: Developed machine learning models to predict biological age from RNA-seq data.
highlights: Developed and trained 3 machine learning models to predict biological age from high-dimensional bulk RNA-seq data.
Engineered a data preprocessing pipeline to clean, log-transform, and z-score standardize gene expression data.
Implemented feature selection using linear modeling and Benjamini-Hochberg correction.
Validated hypothesis that Alzheimer's Disease patients exhibit accelerated biological aging.

work.name: Sekisui Kydex
highlights: Consolidated 200 cloned FileMaker scripts to 7 streamlined prototype scripts.
Hosted a FileMaker archive database to store 4.5 million archived records.
Authored documentation detailing best practices for FileMaker scripts.

work.name: Commonwealth University-Bloomsburg
highlights: Implemented a recursively-defined function (Mahler-Popken complexity) to define the 'cost' of an integer using Python.
Conjectured the function and 6 primitive recursive functions are computable.

work.name: Geisinger Health System
highlights: Analyzed genomic data from Geisinger MyCode and SPARK to investigate sex chromosome aneuploidy and ASD.
Queried 'All of Us' research database for sensitivity analyses.
Contributed to a publication in Nature Communications.
Approved $2 million budget for Community Activities Office.
Interim chair for Committee on Student Organizations.
Co-drafted Academic Distinction policies regarding Dean's List eligibility.

courses: Thesis: Negative Latin Square Type Partial Difference Sets from Non-abelian Groups

awards.title: NSF Grant #2244480
awards.summary: Fellowship for Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) at UC Riverside.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research, Scholarly, and Creative Activity Grant
awards.summary: Awarded $4,800 for project 'Cost of an Integer'.

awards.title: Board of Governor's Science and Technology Merit Scholarship

publications.name: A genome-first study of sex chromosome aneuploidies provides evidence of Y chromosome dosage effects on autism risk
publications.summary: Berry, A. S. F., Finucane, B. M., Myers, S. M., Walsh, L. K., Seibert, J. M., et al. Nature Communications, 15(1), 8897.

publications.name: Constructing an Infinite Family of Negative Latin Square Partial Difference Sets in Nonabelian Groups
Transcriptomic Age Acceleration in Alzheimer's Disease: A Predictive Modeling Approach Using Age-Responsive Genes from GTEx
